questions.text: The Flash and Green Arrow both appeared in the opening scene of the pilot episode.
questions.explanation:
True.

	Viewers hadn't even been properly introduced to Vixen yet, not knowing her powers or even her name when she was introduced being chased by both characters. The chase ran across parts of the city, before Vixen lost her footing and fell off a skyscraper.

questions.text: What city was Vixen in during the flashback to "3 days ago"?
questions.explanation:
Detroit.

	Initially mentioned as Motor City, Vixen's step dad eventually called it by the proper name of Detroit while they were having dinner at a diner. Later he mentioned her traveling outside of Michigan looking for something, but not what it was she was looking for.

questions.text: What item does Vixen hold onto that appears to be the source of her powers?
questions.explanation:
A necklace.

	The item is a totem that holds the power of her family line. It allows her to harness powers and abilities that normal humans can't possibly control. Earlier in the season she had no idea what it was, but she eventually found out that it held the powers of a trickster god. The totem allowed her to harness the powers of any animal she was thinking of.

questions.text: When not going by Vixen, what is her real name?
questions.explanation:
Mari McCabe.

	Lance, Danvers, and Smoak are other woman in the DC television universe. Vixen goes by Mari McCabe, a name given to her by her foster parents in Detroit. When they took her in, she was a baby who had no name yet.

questions.text: Which character, who debuted in "Arrow", gave Vixen her name?
questions.explanation:
Cisco Ramon.

	Cisco Ramon enjoyed naming the bad guys they faced week in and week out. He modified a facial recognition software to search for metahumans and found Vixen in Detroit. He gave her the name because she "looks like a fox".

questions.text: Who did the voice acting for Vixen?
questions.explanation:
Megalyn Echikunwoke.

	Echikunwoke voiced Vixen in all six episodes and also appeared as the character in an episode of "Arrow" in live-action. She made her movie acting debut in 1998's "Creature" and made her first appearance on TV the same year with an episode of "The Steve Harvey Show". Since then she has appeared in more than 40 movie and television roles.

questions.text: While escaping from the evil Kuasa's henchmen, which shoulder was Vixen shot in?
questions.explanation:
Right.

	The man fired a single shot at her and struck her in the right shoulder as she jumped off of a building. Kuasa then kidnapped Vixen and took her all the way to Africa in an attempt to remove the totem from her neck.

questions.text: Kuasa revealed to Mari that they were related. How was that relation explained?
options: Kuasa was Mari from a past life.
questions.explanation:
They were sisters.

	Kuasa explained how she was Mari's older sister, and told her the history of the totem and their family. After explaining the family history, she then told Mari that the only way to break the totem's bond and take it from her would be to kill her.

questions.text: Kuasa was killed while in Africa.
questions.explanation:
False.

	Mari was bitten by a spider, but somehow she managed to survive the bite. After regaining consciousness, she tracked down Kuasa and defeated her, reclaiming the totem for herself. Mari, however, did not kill her sister either.

questions.text: What career did Vixen have when not fighting crime?
questions.explanation:
Fashion design.

	She had been an unsuccessful fashion designer at the beginning the season. At the end of the season, after coming to terms with who she was as a hero, she decided that she could do both. She said she had first needed to find herself before she could make a name for herself in the fashion industry.
